Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.util.data

Class DataFile

java.lang.Object
java.io.File
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.util.data.DataFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<File>
Direct Known Subclasses:
JSONDataFile
public class DataFile extends File
Representation of a physical file at the specified path. Provides methods for reading and writing plain text.
See Also:
  • File

  • Method Details

    • scanner

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true) public @NotNull Scanner scanner()
      Returns a new Scanner that produces values scanned from this file. Bytes from the file are converted characters using the underlying platform's default charset.
      Returns:
      a Scanner for this file

    • writer

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true) public @NotNull BufferedWriter writer(@NotNull @NotNull DataFile.WriteMode mode)
      Creates a BufferedWriter given this to write, using the platform's default charset and a default-sized output buffer. Returned reader is not autocloseable.
      Returns:
      a BufferedWriter given this file to write

    • read

      @NotNull public @NotNull String read()
      Reads and returns contents of this file.
      Returns:
      the contents of this file

    • write

      public void write(@Nullable @Nullable String contents)
      Overwrites the contents of this file with the specified string. If the argument is null, the file is cleared.
      Parameters:
      contents - the new contents of this file
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason

    • append

      public void append(@Nullable @Nullable String string)
      Appends the specified string at the end of this file. If the argument is null, the four characters "null" are appended. Warning: use of this method is not optimal for multiple append operations as a new writer is created on every call. For such cases, it is recommended to create a writer using the writer(com.rubynaxela.kyanite.util.data.DataFile.WriteMode) method and performing the append operation with it.
      Parameters:
      string - the new contents of this file
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason
